TopicTitle: Can old versions of Kerbal be avaible trough costumer account download area ?

Articles.Content: For me, i bought the game in the early development, but i can run the game version 0.15 only. From up the 0.15, it is becoming slow. Can all or some old versions, on demand, be put in costumer account download area ? So i can play 0.15 again...

What are your computer specs? If...

1. It is younger than 5-6 years,

2. Isn't trying to run anything over 300 parts, and

3. It doesn't have any other applications open

Then it should run KSP fine.

http://www.asus.com/Notebooks_Ultrabooks/Eee_PC_1015BX/#specifications

I now have windows xp service pack 3. I tried everything. I don't want tweaks ! I just want some older versions from the developers.

Thanks, but no 0.15 !

That's because the last free version was 13.3. You won't get a free download for a paid game on a forum thread.

Well, it is possible to get 0.15 version from some certain "bay" but it is not exactly legal (not that anyone would really mind it as this version is ancient and you already bought the game anyway). So it is up to you...

Edited February 9, 2014 by jcraft

Oof, a 1.0gh processor. That would barely run the loading screen.

Unless you're really tight on cash, I would recommend updating to a newer laptop. You can get a decent Windows 8 laptop for around $300.
Man, no offence but that computer is ancient, you really need a new one if you want to continue playing.

Than Asus sell ancient PC to undeveloped countries ! Doesen't matter, because i'm glad that i found in my external HD, kerbal 0.15 and 0.16 and some mods. Btw, my netbook is C60 1.0GHz (dual core), but old, LOL.
